channel.title: Crackmapexec on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Crackmapexec on TLDRBins

item.title: NetExec (nxc)
item.description: Basic Commands # Single user, single password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' # Single user, single password, local auth nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth # Single user, single password (Active Directory) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> # Single user, multiple passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> # Multiple users, single password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERNAMES> -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Multiple users, multiple passwords nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERNAMES> -p <PASSWORDS> -d <DOMAIN> --continue-on-success # Match username to corresponding password nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u <USERNAMES> -p <PASSWORDS> --no-bruteforce --continue-on-success # With hash nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H <HASH> # With Kerberos, or STATUS_ACCOUNT_RESTRICTION (NTLM disabled) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k # With Kerberos ccache, or STATUS_NOT_SUPPORTED (NTLM disabled) nxc <PROTOCOL> <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache Hint: we can also run on multiple targets
